# Task

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.



# Data

pig_latinify(["hello", "apple", "strong", "world"])

```julia
function pig_latinify(texts::Vector{String}; nthreads=1)
    results = Vector{Future}(undef, length(texts))
    for (i, text) in enumerate(texts)
        # Calculate the first non-vowel and move it to the end of the word
        first_consonant = findfirst(c -> !isalpha(c) || isuppercase(c), text[1:])
        if first_consonant === nothing
            results[i] = "$(text)[0]"
        else
            last_char = text[end]
            # If the word starts with a consonant, add it to the end of the word
            word = join(text[1:first_consonant - 1], last_char) * "ay"
            results[i] = word
        end
    end

    return collect(results)
end
```

This function finds the first non-vowel (a, e, i, o, u) or non-letter character in a string and moves it to the end of the word. If the word starts with a vowel or is all punctuation/non-letters, it just appends "ay" to the end. The function uses `findfirst` from Base Julia to find the first non-vowel character and then builds the new pig latinified string accordingly.
